snippet: Violent protests at a platinum mine have left at least nine people dead in the past two days, and a large crowd overpowered police officers and stole their weapons, the police said Monday.
abstract: Violent protests at a platinum mine in South Africa leave at least nine people dead in the past two days, and a large crowd overpowers police officers and steals their weapons; the protests and clashes between rival unions took place at a mine run by Lonmin, a leading platinum producer, near Marikana, about 40 miles northwest of Johannesburg.
lead_paragraph: Violent protests at a platinum mine have left at least nine people dead in the past two days, and a large crowd overpowered police officers and stole their weapons, the police said Monday.

headline.main: South Africa: Fatal Clashes at Mine
headline.print_headline: South Africa: Fatal Clashes at Mine
